algebraic_word_problem: A scientist has a 40% alcohol solution and a 70% alcohol solution. How much of each should be mixed to obtain 120 liters of a 50% solution?
reference_answer: 80 liters of 40% solution and 40 liters of 70% solution
step_by_step_solution: Let x = liters of 40% solution and y = liters of 70% solution; x + y = 120; 0.4x + 0.7y = 0.5 * 120; Solve the system.
